page.title: 13FARMING IN WISTON-BY CLASS 4
page.content: We surveyed several farms in the Wiston area.The overall sizes of the farms in our area varied from 95 acres to 400 acres.The average size of a farm was 198 acres.We wanted to find out how much labour was used in farms in 1985 and this turned out to be on average one man per 95 acres.All the farmers told us that this depended on whether the farm was beef or dairy and how much work was done by contractors to make silage. All the farms we surveyedkept cows as the main farm income.Three were dairy,two were mixed dairy and beef and two were beef.The dairy and mixed farms kept Fresian cows while the beef farms kept Hereford with some Holstein cross.Five of the seven farms were self sufficient in feed stuff. The major land cover on all the farms are cultivated grass.
